intro: Ononis glabra, commonly known as slender catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features simple, opposite, and linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, pink or white flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Ononis glabra thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands, roadsides, and waste areas.
